alert.note: Alert for Coffey; Lyon (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 12:47PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Coffey and southern Lyon Counties through 115 PM CDT... At 1247 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northeast of Madison, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Emporia, Burlington, Olpe, New Strawn, Hartford, Gridley, Neosho Rapids and John Redmond Reservoir. This includes Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 117 and 127. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for east central Kansas.
